thread.title: Jeffrey Thompson

author: Jeffrey Thompson
title: Jeffrey Thompson
text: Some of the plans had tricky pricing plans, which made them seem more attractive at particular usage levels, however, when the details were applied to our usage, the cost was actually more, since our usage varied by month, and was not represented by the examples supplies. It would be more helpful to allow us to put in our monthly usage for the last year, and calculate a total cost for the year, which is, in the end, the figure we most want to compare, not cost per kWh at a hypothetical usage level. From their pricing schemes, some providers seem to have tailored their plans to reflect low prices at the 2000 kWh level, but when usage is more than that, they are actually more expensive.
